byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Republican leaders warn that Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker's hard shift to right ahead of presidential launch could jeopardize his prospects in other key states, like New Hampshire, where voters' sensibilities are more moderate; Walker delivered sharp criticism of Supreme Court's ruling on gay marriage and abandoned his support for immigration overhaul.
lead_paragraph: To hold his position in the state before the first Republican nominating contest, the Wisconsin governor has become more conservative on marriage and immigration.

headline.main: Scott Walker’s Hard Right Turn in Iowa May Hurt Him Elsewhere
headline.print_headline: Walker Turns to the Right in Iowa, and Sows Doubt Elsewhere

snippet: To hold his position in the state before the first Republican nominating contest, the Wisconsin governor has become more conservative on marriage and immigration.
